data.title: The president of the Philippines Rodrigo Duterte should be investigated for murder after boasting he "personally" killed three suspected criminals, a top United Nations official said.
Hundreds of Kenyan girls are preparing to spend Christmas in schools, rather than with their families, fearing that their parents will force them to undergo female genital mutilation (FGM)
'Plastic rice' seized in Nigeria. It was very sticky after boiled and "only God knows what would have happened" if people ate it. It had been branded as "Best Tomato Rice".
Canada declares that broadband access Internet service is now considered a basic telecommunications service for all Canadians
Fentanyl has driven Duterte to 'madness' – De Lima
Goldman Sachs ordered to pay $120 million penalty for rate manipulation
North Korea soldiers get diarrhea after Kim Jong Un orders new diet

Freedom of speech is at its lowest worldwide since 1990, according to an annual report from the Committee to Protect Journalists. As of December 1, 2016, there are 259 journalists imprisoned internationally, with Turkey accounting for nearly a third of the global total
Tunisian 'sought over Berlin attack' - German police are searching for a Tunisian man named as Anis A over Berlin market attack - reports
5 dead after Boeing 727 fails to become airborne on liftoff
